data.title: Films directed by Singeetam Srinivasa Rao
data.text:
Overview: America Ammayi is a 1976 Indian Telugu-language film directed by Singeetam Srinivasa Rao. The cross over film was based on the story of Telugu cultural importance in comparison to the western culture ...

Overview: Kaathala Kaathala (transl.) is a 1998 Indian Tamil-language comedy film directed by Singeetam Srinivasa Rao and produced by P. L. Thenappan. The film stars Kamal Haasan, Prabhu Deva, Soundarya and Rambha ...

Release date: 14 April 1998

Genre: Comedy

Two friends, both with the name of Lingam, create a comedy of errors and consequent chaos with their girlfriends and their families.

Overview: Pushpaka Vimana (transl.) is a 1987 Indian comedy film written and directed by Singeetam Srinivasa Rao, who co-produced it with Kannada actor Shringar Nagaraj. The film, which has no dialogue, stars Kamal ...

Release date: 10 September 1987

Genre: Comedy, Thriller, Crime

An unemployed graduate who coincidentally encounters a rich unconscious man, and takes over his lifestyle by keeping him a prisoner. However, he is in ...

Overview: Mumbai Xpress is a 2005 Hindi-language comedy film directed by Singeetam Srinivasa Rao, starring Kamal Haasan, Manisha Koirala, Om Puri, Vijay Raaz, Ramesh Aravind and Sharat Saxena. The film is written ...

Release date: 15 April 2005

Genre: Comedy

After having spent his entire life in Bombay's Dharavi slums, Digamber feels it is time that he takes steps to improve his lifestyle...

Overview: Bhagyada Lakshmi Baramma (Kannada: ಭಾಗ್ಯದ ಲಕ್ಷ್ಮೀ ಬಾರಮ್ಮ; English: Come, goddess of luck) is a 1986 Kannada comedy film. The title of the film was borrowed from a devaranama written by 15-16 th century ...

Producer: Parvathamma Rajkumar

In order to win a huge amount of money in a competition, Pandu and Parvathi pretend to have been married.

Overview: Raja Paarvai (transl.) is a 1981 Indian Tamil-language romance film directed by Singeetam Srinivasa Rao. The story was written by Kamal Haasan, for whom the film was his 100th as an actor and first as ...

Overview: Mayuri (transl.) is a 1985 Telugu-language biographical dance film produced by Ramoji Rao, directed by Singeetam Srinivasa Rao. It was dubbed into Malayalam and (Tamil) as Mayoori and remade as Naache ...

Release date: 15 August 1984

Genre: Musical, Family

The real story of a classical dancer, who loses her leg in an accident and fights her way back as a dancer.

Overview: Little John is a 2001 trilingual fantasy film written, executive produced and directed by Singeetam Srinivasa Rao. Bentley Mitchum and Jyothika play the lead roles with Anupam Kher, and Nassar playing ...

Genre: Romance, Musical, Fantasy, Drama

Indian-born and brought up Vani is in love with U.K. born John. Vani's family does not approve of John...

Overview: Phool (transl.) is a 1993 Bollywood film directed by Singeetam Srinivasa Rao starring Kumar Gaurav and Madhuri Dixit in lead roles along with Sunil Dutt and Rajendra Kumar in supporting roles. The film ...

Producer: Rajendra Kumar

Farmers Dharamraaj and Balram Choudhary are two friends who live in Ram Nagar in scenic Ooty. While...

Overview: Michael Madana Kama Rajan is a 1990 Indian Tamil-language comedy film directed by Singeetam Srinivasa Rao and written by Kamal Haasan, with Crazy Mohan penning the dialogues. The film stars Haasan in four ...

Genre: Comedy

A comedy of errors with identical quadruplets, separated at birth, coming together as adults.
